pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:3.1: The chapter on offenses entailing suspension
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:4.1: 4. The training rule on reinstating one who has been ejected
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:5.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:5.2: At that time the nun Caṇḍakāḷī started quarrels and disputes, and created legal issues in the midst of the Order.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:5.3: But when a legal procedure was being done against her, the nun Thullanandā protested against it.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:5.4: Soon afterwards Thullanandā went to a village on some business.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:5.6: took the opportunity to eject Caṇḍakāḷī for not seeing an offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:5.7: When Thullanandā had finished her business in that village, she returned to Sāvatthī.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:5.8: Upon her return, Caṇḍakāḷī neither prepared a seat for her, nor set out a foot-stool, a foot-scraper, or water for washing, and she did not go out to meet her to take her bowl and robe and to ask whether she wanted anything to drink.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:5.10: why she was acting like this.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:5.11: She replied, “That is how it is, Venerable, when one is without a protector.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:5.12: “But how is it, Venerable, that you’re without a protector?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:5.14: that I was without a protector and that no-one would speak up for me because of my bad reputation, they ejected me for not seeing an offense.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:6.2: “They are incompetent fools. They don’t know about legal procedures, the flaws in such procedures, or what constitutes their failure or successful accomplishment.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:6.3: But we know all these things.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:6.4: We can get procedures done that have not been done, or we can get procedures that have been done invalidated.” And having quickly assembled an Order of nuns, she reinstated the nun Caṇḍakāḷī.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:7.1: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:7.2: “How could Venerable Thullanandā reinstate a nun who has been ejected by a complete Order in accordance with the Teaching, the training, and the Teacher’s instruction, without the permission of the Order that did the legal procedure and without the consent of the group?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:7.3: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā did this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:7.6: How can the nun Thullanandā reinstate a nun who has been ejected by a complete Order in accordance with the Teaching, the training, and the Teacher’s instruction, without the permission of the Order that did the legal procedure and without the consent of the group?
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:7.7: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:7.8: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:8.1: ‘If a nun, without the permission of the Order that did the legal procedure and without the consent of the group, reinstates a nun who has been ejected by a complete Order in accordance with the Teaching and the training and the Teacher’s instruction, then that nun too has committed an immediate offense entailing sending away and suspension.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:9.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination by both complete Orders through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:12.2: in accordance with that legitimate act, in accordance with that Monastic Law.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:13.2: in accordance with the Conqueror’s instruction, in accordance with the Buddha’s instruction.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:16.1: If, intending to reinstate her, she searches for a group or establishes a boundary, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:16.2: After the motion, she commits an offense of wrong conduct. After each of the first two announcements, she commits a serious offense. When the last announcement is finished, she commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:20.2: … Therefore, too, it is called an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:21.1: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, and she perceives it as legitimate, and she reinstates her, she commits an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:21.2: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but she is unsure if it is, and she reinstates her, she commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:22.2: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but she is unsure if it is, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:22.3: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, and she perceives it as illegitimate, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
